cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 450 mi (720 km) south of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest tonight, then turning north-northeast on Wednesday, tracking toward the northern Gulf Coast with a landfall expected late Wednesday before accelerating inland across MS/AL and the southeast U.S.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana to Mississippi coast (near the mouth of the Mississippi River)

weather_observation.under_watch: None (closest watch area is west of Morgan City LA)
weather_observation.watch_coast: West of Morgan City to Intracoastal City, Louisiana (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mississippi/Alabama border to Okaloosa/Walton County Line, Florida (Tropical Storm Warning); Storm Surge Warning Mouth of the Atchafalaya River, LA, to Navarre, FL including Mobile Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana through coastal Mississippi, Alabama, and the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Yes (3–5 ft possible in Mobile Bay)
weather_observation.wind: Damaging tropical-storm-force winds (with a 28% chance of 50-kt gusts) likely Wednesday afternoon-night; higher gusts possible in squalls.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 3–5 ft inundation possible for Dauphin Island to the AL/FL border, including Mobile Bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with isolated totals to 6 inches could cause flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: A few tornadoes possible Wednesday and Wednesday night in southern Alabama.
